title: Sweat holds most promise for noninvasive testing

title_detail.value: Sweat holds most promise for noninvasive testing

summary: Medical researchers have been creating new sensors on a wearable patch the size of a Band-Aid that stimulates sweat even when a patient is cool and resting. The sensor measures specific analytes over time that doctors can use to determine how the patient is responding to a drug treatment.

The sensor measures specific analytes over time that doctors can use to determine how the patient is responding to a drug treatment.
